title: 113_s2764
content: The "American Livestock Protection and Ranching Opportunity Act of 2014" emphasizes the importance of country-of-origin labeling for meat products to meet consumer demand and ensure food safety. Additionally, the Act prohibits the importation of fresh meat and meat products from countries with foot-and-mouth disease. Section 10404 of the Animal Health Protection Act is amended to prohibit the importation of fresh meat and meat products from countries with foot-and-mouth disease until certified disease-free. Additionally, the Livestock Disease Initiative is introduced under Title IV of the Agricultural Research, Extension, and Education Reform Act of 1998. The Livestock Disease Initiative established by the Department provides competitive grants for research and development to eligible entities such as Federal agencies, National Laboratories, and research institutions. Priority is given to research on diseases like bovine brucellosis and tuberculosis. Grant recipients must conduct research on surveillance methods, vaccines, and diagnostic tests for livestock diseases. The Livestock Disease Initiative offers grants for research on diseases like bovine brucellosis and tuberculosis. Priority is given to proposals from eligible entities that provide matching funds, but it is not a requirement for receiving a grant. The authorization of appropriations for this initiative is $5,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2015 to 2018. Additionally, assistance for losses due to brucellosis is included in the Agricultural Act of 2014. In paragraph (1)(A), "fire condition" is amended to include "or brucellosis". Paragraph (2) is revised to include brucellosis as a condition for assistance. Livestock producers affected by brucellosis in the Greater Yellowstone Designated Surveillance Area may receive assistance under specific conditions. The payment rate for assistance under this paragraph is 60 percent of the monthly feed cost for the eligible livestock producer subject to quarantine. SEC. 5. Livestock indemnity payments amended to 75 percent of market value or nationwide price. SEC. 6. Price adjustment for high-value forage in livestock forage disaster program.
